title: 94/941/EC: Council Decision of 14 December 1994 laying down transitional measures applicable to imports of fishery products from third countries
header:
COUNCIL DECISION
of 14  December 1994
laying down transitional measures applicable to imports of fishery products from  third countries
(94/941/EC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
main_body: Until 1 March 1995 Member States shall retain the existing conditions  for imports of fishery products as referred to in Article 11 (7) of Directive 91/493/EEC, together  with the specimen health certificate referred to in the Annex to Decision 93/185/EEC.

By way of derogation from the provisions specified in Article 7 (3) and Article 11 (5)  of Directive 91/493/EEC, the lists of approved establishments and, if appropriate, approved factory  ships in respect of which a decision has to be taken in accordance with Article 11 (4) (c) of the  said Directive must be updated every two months.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 14 December 1994.
For the Council
The President
T. BORCHERT
